1: Then Bildad the Shuhite answered and said,\q
2:
"When will you stop your talk?\q Consider, and afterwards we will speak.


\q
3:
Why are we regarded as beasts;\q why have we become stupid in your sight?
\q
4:
You who tear at yourself in your anger,\q should the earth be forsaken for you
\q or should the rocks be removed out of their places?


\q
5:
Indeed, the light of the wicked person will be put out;\q the spark of his fire will not shine.
\q
6:
The light will be dark in his tent;\q his lamp above him will be put out.


\q
7:
The steps of his strength will be made short;\q his own plans will cast him down.
\q
8:
For he will be thrown into a net by his own feet;\q he will walk into a pitfall.


\q
9:
A trap will take him by the heel;\q a snare will lay hold on him.
\q
10:
A noose is hidden for him on the ground;\q and a trap for him in the way.
\q
11:
Terrors will make him afraid on every side;\q they will chase him at his heels.


\q
12:
His wealth will turn into hunger,\q and calamity will be ready at his side.
\q
13:
The parts of his body will be devoured;\q indeed, the firstborn of death will devour his parts.


\q
14:
He is torn from the safety of his tent\q and marched off to the king of terrors.
\q
15:
People not his own will live in his tent\q after they see that sulfur is scattered within his home.


\q
16:
His roots will be dried up beneath;\q above will his branch be cut off.
\q
17:
His memory will perish from the earth;\q he will have no name in the street.


\q
18:
He will be driven from light into darkness\q and be chased out of this world.
\q
19:
He will have no son or son's son among his people,\q nor any remaining kinfolk where he had stayed.
\q
20:
Those who live in the west will be horrified at what happens to him one day;\q those who live in the east will be frightened by it.


\q
21: Surely such are the homes of unrighteous people,\q the places of those who do not know God."
